original_title: Sri Lanka to hike Treasury Bill ceiling
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will hike a ceiling on Treasury bills to 6,000 billion rupees from the current 5,000 billion rupees, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Bandula Gunawardana told reporters.
By end March 2023 Sri Lanka had already had a stock of 4,636 billion rupees of Treasury bills in issue, Minister Gunawardana said.
Treasury bills are sold in 3, 6 and 12 months with three month bills rolled over four times, 6 month bills twice and one bills once. New funds are also raised with fresh funds.

Sri Lanka’s interest rates have shot up to around 25 percent after the latest currency collapse from flexible inflation targeting/out put gap targeting which led to external sovereign debt default requiring domestic debt re-structuring to meet International Monetary Fund debt sustainability requirements.

For the year 2023 Sri Lanka’s parliament had set a gross borrowing limit of 4,979 billion rupees, of which 4,526 billion of was from local sources. Another 1,453 was from foreign sources. (Colombo/May03/2023 – Data in para 1 and 2)
